thread.title: Leafs-Arizona Coyotes: Game preview
thread.title_full: Maple Leafs-Arizona Coyotes: Game preview | Toronto Star

author: Mark Zwolinski
title: Leafs-Arizona Coyotes: Game preview
text:
AIR CANADA CENTRE
Puck Drop: 7:30 pm
TV: TSN 4
Radio: Sportsnet 590 The Fan
Key Matchup: Leafs coach Mike Babcock will assign some checking forwards to contain Arizona rookies Max Domi and Anthony Duclair . It will be interesting to see how the Leafs tackle these two youngsters.
Need to Know: Mikkel Boedker had the hat trick in Ottawa Saturday as the Coyotes took a 4-1 decision over the Sens to snap a four-game losing streak. The hat trick was a welcome breakout for Boedker, whose 2014-15 season was cut short at 45 games due to an operation (spleen).
Veteran Antoine Vermette missed the game Saturday with a lower body injury, ending his consecutive games played streak at 482. It was the second- longest active streak in the NHL, and Vermette was trying to become the 21st NHLer ever to play in 500 consecutive games.
Arizona, like the Leafs, are struggling with their powerplay. The Coyotes, after posting a seventh-ranked 20 per cent success rate last season, are at 10.5 per cent so far this season.
Up Next: Friday, Oct. 30, at New York Rangers
